result.title: Occidental in talks to sell OxyChem unit for at least $10 billion, FT reports
result.text: Occidental Petroleum is negotiating the sale of its OxyChem division, a transaction that could value the unit at a minimum of $10 billion, the Financial Times reported on Sunday.

result.title: 3 US Integrated Energy Stocks to Gain Despite Industry Headwinds
result.text: Softer crude prices, slowing production growth and mounting renewable demand are making the prospects for the Zacks Oil & Gas US Integrated industry gloomy. ConocoPhillips (COP), Occidental (OXY) and National Fuel (NFG) are well-positioned to survive the challenges.

result.title: Thoughts On Midstream Energy Firms
result.text: Midstream energy firms offer attractive income investments, with business models and financial structures impacting growth, valuation, and yield opportunities. MLPs like EPD and MPLX are discounted versus corporations, offering higher yields but facing investor aversion due to K-1 tax forms. Strong performers such as Enterprise Products Partners (EPD) and MPLX demonstrate sensible growth, rising dividends, and robust balance sheets.
